result.execSummary:
The defendant Loren W Pate was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery [Modifiers: Repeater], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500 [Modifiers: Repeater], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged or terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of any restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.  If the defendant is placed on probation or released to extended supervision, IT IS ORDERED that the defendant pay supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections.
You shall have no contact, directly or indirectly, either personally, by mail, telephone or through any other person with the victim in this case, F.B.

The defendant shall comply with any treatment, evaluations, including AODA, and/or programming as deemed appropriate by a risk and needs assessment and the probation agent.  Defendant must sign any releases agent deems necessary to verify defendant's compliance with probation conditions.  Must comply with any other recommendations of your agent.  
Must submit a DNA sample if not already on file and pay the surcharge.  There is no restitution ordered.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Loren W Pate

records.addlTxt: Notice of Intent/Judgment for Unpaid Fines returned.  "Not Deliverable as Addressed"

Defendant appears in custody in person with counsel SPD Amanda Roush.  Assistant District Attorney, Emily Hynek appeared on behalf of the State.  

16CM31 - Revocation hearing - State is in compliance with victim rights notification.  They received no response.  18CM65 -- there is no victim in that case either.

18CM65 Sentencing:  Defense states he will plead to Count 2 and DRI Count 1.  There is a joint recommendation for 60 days jail.  Court reviews the charge and potential penalties for Count 2 - enters a plea of no contest.  Court performs a plea/waiver of rights colloquy with the defendant.  Court finds he is competent to proceed today.  Deportation warning given.  Defense stipulates to the factual basis found in the complaint that supports the plea to Count 2.  Court finds he understands the proceedings, and freely, voluntarily, knowingly and intelligently waives his rights/enters his plea; factual basis exists and he is found guilty of Count 2.

State requests a 60 day jail term.  Defense states this is a joint recommendation and he has 87 days credit, which would make it time served.  Defendant exercises his right to allocution.  Court adopts the joint recommendation and orders 60 days jail with credit for 60 days served.  Must pay the costs at $50 per month commencing 7-15-18 with failure to pay 1 day jail for each $25 left unpaid.  Must provide a DNA sample.  

16CF31 - Revocation:  Victim has not returned anything to the State.  Neither attorney notes any changes or corrections to revocation summary.  ADA Hynek states the DOC recommends a 4-6 month jail term and agrees 6 months is appropriate.  Defense agrees with the DOC recommendation of 4-6 months jail.  Currently has 148 days credit which would be time served.  Defendant exercises his right to allocution.  

Court adopts the joint recommendations and orders a jail term of 6 months with credit of 148 days served which is deemed time served.  Civil judgment entered for unpaid court obligations.  Defense will file the appeal rights.
Inmate Furlough Request.  Allowed by the court.
Sentencing hearing on revocation on June 14, 2018 at 02:30 pm.
Sent to Judge 5/30.  JMM
from DOC

Amendment Judgment of Conviction
From DOC with Waiver of Appearance and Proposed Order for Amendment to Judgment of Conviction

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: 3 fingerprint cards
DNA submission form

Defendant appears in person in custody with counsel SPD Carly Sebion.  Gerald Fox appears for the State.  State filed an amended Information, will plea to Counts 2 & 3 with Count 1 DRI.  Have a joint recommendation.  Victim never responded to DA's requests.  Waives reading of the amended Information.  Judge reviews counts and potential penalties in Information.  Defendant states he understands.  Count 2 - Plea of no contest.  Court reviews elements with defendant.  Admits to prior felony conviction.  Count 3 - Plea of no contest.  Court reviews elements with defendant.  Court performs plea/waiver of rights colloquy with defendant.  Court accepts waiver of rights and accepts pleas.  Defense stipulates the complaint contains a factual basis for his pleas.  Court finds he understands the proceedings, please made F,V,K,I made and he understands the rights he's waiving.  Finding of guilty on Count 2 and Count 3.  Count 1 is DRI.  Joint recommendation is:  2 years probation on each count concurrent to each other but consecutive to any sentence he is now currently serving.  No sentence credit.  Defense requests no restitution or that a restitution hearing be scheduled.  DA Fox re-states that the VW Coordinator got nothing back from him in this case.  Defendant exercises his right to allocution.  Court adopts the joint recommendation and orders 2 years probation on both counts concurrent to each other, but consecutive to any other sentence now serving with conditions that he must undergo a risk and needs assessment, comply with any recommendations including AODA, sign releases, no contact with victim, F.B.  Must provide DNA sample if not already on file, pay costs, including DNA surcharge.  Court will not order restitution in this case.
Per Atty Sebion, MH canceled and set for PLEAS instead.
Plea/sentencing hearing on August 5, 2016 at 03:00 pm.

Motion hearing on August 5, 2016 at 03:00 pm.
Waive reading of the complaint.  Defendant stood mute.  NGP entered by the court.  Future court dates have already been set.
Information filed with the court.

DA Gerald Fox appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in person, in custody, with Attorney Sebion.  State called Deputy J.S.  Sworn.  Employment and training reviewed.  State questioned the witness regarding 9/7/15 incident.  Venue established.  Described items the victim said were taken, and the injuries to the victim.  Witness identified the defendant.  Attorney Sebion cross examined the witness.  DA questioning the examination by defense.  Credibility of the victim not at issue at preliminary hearing, per State.  Attorney Sebion continued cross examination of the witness.  State redirect.  Attorney Sebion recross.  State redirect.  Attorney Sebion recross.  No other witnesses.  State moved for bind over.  Attorney Sebion requested that count 1 and 2 be dismissed.  Court ordered bind over.
Subpoena and Certificate of Appearance served on deptuty J.S. to appear at 6/29 preliminary hearing.
Jury trial - 12 person on September 7, 2016 at 09:00 am.
Final pre-trial on August 15, 2016 at 03:00 pm.
Preliminary hearing on June 29, 2016 at 02:00 pm.
Defendant's
Per telephone conference with Atty Sebion and Arin at DA's office, STC for 5/2/16 canceled and to be set for 2 day jury trial.
